title: Standing waves - beat freq for 2 open-closed tubes

content.question: Two tuning forks are each held above a hollow tube that is open at the top end and closed at the bottom end, as shown in the figure. One tube has length <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and the other tube has length <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. The frequencies of the tuning forks are unknown, but each tuning fork creates a standing wave at the fundamental frequency in the tube directly below it. If the speed of sound in the surrounding air is <math alttext="v sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math>, what is the beat frequency produced by the two tuning forks?

choices.label: <math alttext="2 v sub s, end sub, times the absolute value of, L sub 2, end sub, minus, L sub 1, end sub, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>S</mi></msub><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 v sub s, end sub, times the absolute value of, L sub 2, end sub, minus, L sub 1, end sub, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>S</mi></msub><mrow><mo>|</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>|</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub s, end sub, and denominator 2, end fraction, times the absolute value of, the fraction 1 over L sub 2, end sub, end fraction, minus, the fraction 1 over L sub 1, end sub, end fraction, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>S</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>|</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>|</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub s, end sub, and denominator 4, end fraction, times the absolute value of, the fraction 1 over L sub 2, end sub, end fraction, minus, the fraction 1 over L sub 1, end sub, end fraction, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>S</mi></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>|</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>|</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator v sub s, end sub, and denominator 4, end fraction, times the absolute value of, the fraction 1 over L sub 2, end sub, end fraction, minus, the fraction 1 over L sub 1, end sub, end fraction, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>S</mi></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>|</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>|</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
